Document Sources.Sourced Statement: Since 2020, the number of homeless students in Santa Clara County has almost doubled, according to the California Department of Education.

Out of the 1,974 homeless students enrolled at East Side in 2022-2023, 488 were living in temporary shelters, according to the state education department, while 75 students were living in hotels and motels, and 33 students were temporarily unsheltered or living in abandoned buildings, campgrounds, vehicles, trailer parks or train and bus stations.
Around 78% of homeless students were unable to meet the standards for mathematics, while 51% were unable to meet the standard for language arts.
Document Sources.Source Justification: Results from the Smarter Balanced Summative Assessments, standardized tests for mathematics and language arts
